title: Kha'zix needs more than just some piddly 20 point buff to his lvl 1 W heal.
body:
Maybe fix the fact that there's literally no benefit whatsoever to evolving Q unless your target is dumb enough to be the 3 miles away from *anything* required for them to be isolated.

Or, hell, maybe don't make the isolation range insane.

Or maybe revert the "turrets cancel isolation" since they're inanimate stone statues, last anyone checked.

Or maybe give his ultimate something worthwile since an ulting Vayne has Kha'zix's ult in a much better form in every way.

I mean just saying. We all know what'll happen is you guys give him this tiny buff to something that isn't one of his major flaws, call him "fixed" because he'll be slightly shinier garbage now, and then never look at him again for years if at all. He deserves more than this, seeing as he was repeatedly nerfed more than just about any champion in the entire *history* of the game and all in like 1 season where spirit stone existed as an option. 

I appreciate you guys looking at him, I mean that, I really do. But this is kind of a slap to the face, because it indicates not only an apparent severe lack of understanding of the champion and it's players, but also a lack of interest in genuinely improving his situation, just saying "yeah, THAT must be why the assassin can't assassinate for shit! Cuz he obviously needs more sustain!". 

His first clear is rough, yes. But trying to actually perform the champion's job vs any team with *any* sense of positioning or warding is far worse, considering his success is *directly* tied to isolation and you guys made isolation utter crap. I'm not denying he could use the heal buff, I'm saying if this is the *only* buff you guys are shipping out to him, you literally picked the *least* crippling of the champion's inadequacies (many of which where ham-handedly forced onto him with the almost fanatical-looking waves of nerfs you gave him), rather than any of the changes that he *actually* needs.

Source for those interested: http://www.surrenderat20.net/2015/04/410-pbe-update.html

Reiteration for those who can't read: The heal isn't a bad buff, it just fixes the *least* interesting, *least* frustrating, *least* restrictive part of a champion who was overnerfed and is now a sad husk of the character he's supposed to be.  It's not a *bad* buff, it's just the *last one they should've prioritized, if they were only going to ship 1 buff*.

replies.body: The buff to his w healing is actually going to help quite a bit when clearing the jungle. But I agree that he needs more. Perhaps a minor decrease in isolation range (20-30).

That's my point: Yes, the heal will help. But the *least* important, *least* frustrating, *least* character-defining aspect of Kha'zix.

**Nobody** picks Kha for his sustain and having slightly more sustain doesn't fix the fact that the champions *core gameplay* is still incredibly restrictive and weak. 

The biggest things he needs right now are an Iso range reduction and *some* bonus damage on Evolved Q for non-iso targets. An actually worthwile ultimate Evo would be nice, but it's not the priority. ***LEAST*** of all the things he needs is a minor buff to his early sustain, which is what this is.

Accidentally deleted my post without saving. In summary, here is what I said.

Your choice of words is misleading. Technically there is nothing *forcing* the enemy to not stand in their minion wave. Realistically, however, there are several factors that determine the enemy's positioning, including whether they are top or mid and whether they are ranged or melee. For these cases I am assuming Kha is 6 and has evolved Q. 

Obviously there are exceptions to every case, so I will be using a generic champ model. Trades are assumed to be basic skill usages and auto attacks.

If the enemy decides to stand in their own minion wave (top melee is the most common observation), Kha needs to chip away at their health with Q. If they decide to trade, use W and aa to proc passive, and follow up with more aa's and a Q while they are slowed. Rinse and repeat until the enemy decides to back off because they fear dying (if they don't, all in them). Desired position achieved.

If you want, I can retype each case I mentioned to the best of my ability.

So you are saying that at no point in time does a melee top laner stand with his melee minions last hitting Kha's melee minions? 

In this situation, Kha doesn't telegraph going in for a Q on the enemy champ. He can stand halfway between his melee and caster minions *and still* hit the enemy champion with a Q. It's also on a 3.5 second cooldown.

> for some reason you're under the impression that Kha's W+AA+Proc will out-trade any QWER combo (or whatever the order is) of any top/mid champ.

It is unlikely that a champion will use their ult for a simple trade. Like I said earlier, Kha is level 6 and an extra point in W has been taken. If Kha has 20 bonus ad (being conservative, 10-15 comes from runes and masteries), W+AA+Proc+Q hits for 391 damage before armor. Additional auto attacks will also usually occur because the enemy is slowed. That's a pretty significant chunk of damage, especially considering Kha heals for 70. 

If you want to do the math for every other laner (preferably not outstanding cases such as{{champion:92}} or {{champion:7}} ; as I said before, there are always exceptions), feel free. It would make for a more precise argument.

I think {{champion:121}} might still need some work after this, but the buff he's getting is pretty significant (your healing is increased by 50% at rank 1, which is no small change). My main concern is that this might shift him a bit more towards bruiser territory again, which is always a potential issue with his kit, but the immediate benefit to that buff is that his jungle clears will be a lot healthier.

On a larger scale, I think it might be better to have Kha unlock all four of his evolutions over time, instead of just three: while the element of choice is great for planning out specialized strategies, it also means one evolution is inevitably going to be left out due to a more dominant playstyle emerging from the other three, which then just leads to a reshuffling in power that creates another imbalance. Situationality is fine on his Q, especially since there's potentially a huge amount of power to be had from that, but it's not going to be as palatable when all of Kha's other evolutions offer more guaranteed bonuses. His W is the biggest offender,  and instead of making his W easier to land and clear with, I think it should facilitate Kha's diving potential against single targets. If Evolved Spike Racks fired only one projectile, for example, but temporarily isolated the primary target instead, Kha would be able to use his isolation mechanic more predictably, though still with a certain degree of unreliability. It would also make Kha much better at picking off single targets, which he's designed to do, instead of poking/waveclearing/multi-target CCing, which his current evolved W reinforces.

You fail to realize that this is only an early game change. His final level of W offers no change in healing potential.

I should elaborate: his jungle clear is not what is setting  him back from being a good jungler, though it hurts. What sets him back is his inability to reliably deal assassin-level damage to a target due to circumstances that are completely outside of your control (whether or not they are isolated). Kha'zix has some of the easiest counterplay imaginable: stand near a tower, minions, or allies and you take minimal damage from him.

I completely agree: the biggest problem with Kha's isolation mechanic is that it's completely beyond his control, and I think he should be able to access it in a manner that encourages interesting play for both him and his target, instead of the effect's current binary state. I still think the buff he's getting is a pretty good one, even if it's just an early game increase (Kha doesn't need more late-game sustain anyways). I'd like to see more changes to Kha'Zix after that, but I'm pretty sure this is going to help him out a fair bit.
